message: when the exception is raised, you'll get a backtrace in the terminal. all of those methods mentioned in the backtrace are places where you can rescue it.

I'm trying to use libusb in ruby. My script runs fine, but if the USB device is unplugged, I want it to exit.  I'm trying to catch an Errno exception, but I can't figure out where to catch it.  It is thrown while other code is executing, because it's essentially an interrupt from the OS (i beleive).  Does anyone know how to catch it?
